column5: Hey there guys,  Well I'm unemployed at the moment and with only 1 year left, I really need to start looking for some experience that is related to my field of study (Environmental Science - Biology stream). If you know of a company in my field is hiring, please let me know! I have a car, so transportation is not much of an issue. Preferably within 30 min drive of GTA. Full time or part time. Please PM me!   Thanks for any help, Kevin
how bout policing? I went to the police college with 2 guys who were in the same position you are and joined OPP and York....not a bad option

Or the Military.  You can always move.  Mayor of Oshawa told the Priemier of Sask that he would like his unemployed people work here for a week then go home on weekends.  We like the Idea here because we need the workers, but I dont think its practical.  Its not Fort McMurray yet
Professional Bass Fishermen Kevin!!!

I don't know your particular background or schooling, but as an environmental professional I suggest you canvas local engineering firms. They are always hiring students and new grads. The bigger the company the more likely they will need entry level staff. Many professionals start in consulting and move on to other positions later. Environmental jobs don't commonly pay well at the entry level, but the money increases quickly after a few years. This is the time of year that  employers start looking for new hires. You should expect to see lots of job postings in the next two months for entry level positions.
Maybe someone's doing a new study on the Grand River that you can help with Kevin...  Good luck in your hunt for employement!

That would be the Grand River Conservation Authority (GRCA). Actually, most conservation aurthorities (CA's) will be hiring summer students, but those jobs usually start in May or June. You can also try volunteering with your local CA, which is probably Toronto and Region Conservation Authority (TRCA) to get your foot in the door. TRCA used to pay volunteers $10 a day.
I've looked into TRCA already, looks like a good first step. Aswell the consulting job does pay well after some years of experience! I'll keep looking.. and keep 'em coming!   Thanks guys  Kevin
Yeah but then they will be called naysayers and crack smokers that can read..... we would not want that would we?  G
MNR just released summer job posting this week from what I understand.  -R-
You might try checking with the O.F.A.H., I know it is a little more than 30 minutes from the GTA but the experience would be worth it.
Military is a good option I think every young Buck should do a 3 year stint who knows maybe you might like it
Where's Headhunter! Drop him a PM  Good luck!

Saw this yesterday and wanted to strap on my thinking cap as this is not an area that I participate in professionally... that being said, you may want to contact  this company as I know they are very successful and have been hiring good people of late; http://www.highpointenvironmental.ca/index.html Good luck and let me know if I can help! HH
Okay... yah got him hooked up Joe! Now ya got a spot for a graphic designer and a software writer... I need my house back !

ok I am looking for a job 100K starting wage great pension plan all benefits paid for 6 weeks vacation flexible work hours nonphysical labour computer type work..with internet access and http://www.ofncommunity.com not blocked supervisor must be kind  forgiving, good sense of humour, deaf and blind would help maybe good looking slutty secretaries would be a perk too  if anyone know of a company like that, please contact me
City of Toronto is lookin for you Terry! HH
Wayne, I have a position downtown, entry level for someone who has some I.I. experience, SQL and a desire to learn and grow... does that help? HH
Any job in politics Terry!  (Just ask Mr. Clinton)

Terry, I have the perfect job for you; all you have to do is receive payments for us from our customers and forward the money to us by Western Union, you get to keep a full 30% of what ever you collect for us up to $100,000.00 a month + any expenses you might incure in supporting an office and staff. Please forward details of your bank account etc. so we can advise our customers where to send the money!
